text: Elizabeth de Beauchamp Goudge (24 April 1900 â€“ 1 April 1984) was an English author of novels, short stories and children's books. She wrote under the name Elizabeth Goudge. She received a Carnegie Medal for children's books in 1946 for The Little White Horse. She became a best selling author, both in the United Kingdom and United States. She was born in Wells, Somerset, England. She died at the age of 83. title: Elizabeth Goudge
